outputs.output_descr: The objective of the NCSA project for Solomon Islands project is to assess Solomon Islands' capacity to address global and local environmental issues, and to develop a plan for implementation of key activities to achieve capacity building needs identified. This will be done through a country-driven consultative process,  that takes into account Solomon Islands' obligations under the three global conventions on biodiversity, climate change and desertification/land degradation. The assessment will provide national decision-makers and funding agencies with essential information about Solomon Islands' specific capacity needs to meet its international environmental obligations. The resulting document will identify prioritized national capacity needs, a resources mobilization strategy and a capacity development action plan to guide further actions for the strengthening of national capacity.

project_title: PIMS 2640 NC EA: National Capacity Self Assessment
